alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:49PM EST until January 14 at 5:12AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Twiggs, Bibb, Houston, Monroe and Jones Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand. Large portions of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to 3 feet deep on portions of the trail. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under 1 to 5 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 22.2 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Friday was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
